content.body: Andreu Botella: if you do something like `class CustomError extends Error { name = "CustomError" }` the `name` won't get preserved (and neither will the subclass)

content.body: Perhaps that's not a concern though. If they don't end up doing anything like serialization/deserialization I won't care too much.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Perhaps that's not a concern though. If they don't end up doing anything like serialization/deserialization I won't care too much.

content.body: annevk: re fetch controller, the initial plan was to have it reported from within fetch, but then we wanted to allow callers to be in charge of when reporting happens, whether it happens at all, and to affect the `response end` time. The change of behavior would be mainly for scripts, because they won't be able to report timing as if it was a network error after the response has arrived, but maybe that's OK
